snippet: In a year that was monopolized by the “Fifty Shades” erotic novels and knockoffs, e-book sales in fiction rose 42 percent over the year before, to $1.8 billion.
abstract: Survey of publishers shows that e-book sales gave book business lift in 2012; thriving romance genre, propelled by Fifty Shades erotic novels and their various knockoffs, boosted sales in fiction 42 percent for year, to $1.8 billion; growth in nonfiction e-book sales was smaller, with 22 percent increase, to $484.2 million; sales in children's and young-adult categories increased 117 percent, to $469.2 million.
lead_paragraph: In a year that was monopolized by the “Fifty Shades” erotic novels and knockoffs, e-book sales in fiction rose 42 percent over the year before, to $1.8 billion.

headline.seo: E-Book Sales a Boon to Publishers in 2012
headline.main: E-Book Sales a Boon to Publishers in 2012
headline.print_headline: Propelled by ‘Fifty Shades’ in 2012, E-Book Sales Buoyed Publishers
